description: Images from the Friends of Farthing Downs Fungi Walk on 1st November 2014

images.description: Tiny greyish caps in clumps on rotting stumps
images.suggested_alt_text: Fairy bonnets (Coprinellus disseminatus) - tiny greyish mushroom caps growing in dense clusters on a rotting log
images.suggested_caption: Fairy bonnets (Coprinellus disseminatus) growing on fallen wood at Farthing Downs

images.description: Unidentified fungus species - image too indistinct to differentiate
images.suggested_alt_text: Unidentified fungus specimen from Farthing Downs fungi foray
images.suggested_caption: Fungus specimen found during the 2014 fungi walk

images.description: Tan, pear-shaped puffball with branched mycelial cords at base, grows on wood
images.suggested_alt_text: Pear-shaped puffballs (Lycoperdon pyriforme) growing on deadwood
images.suggested_caption: Pear-shaped Puffball (Lycoperdon pyriforme) found on fallen wood

images.description: Hard crumbly black balls on dead ash - mature specimen
images.suggested_alt_text: King Alfred's Cakes (Daldinia concentrica) - mature black fungus balls on dead wood
images.suggested_caption: King Alfred's Cakes (Daldinia concentrica) - mature specimen showing characteristic black colour

images.description: Hard crumbly brown balls on dead ash - young specimen
images.suggested_alt_text: King Alfred's Cakes (Daldinia concentrica) - young brown fungus balls
images.suggested_caption: King Alfred's Cakes (Daldinia concentrica) - young specimen before turning black

images.description: Tan, pear-shaped puffball growing on wood
images.suggested_alt_text: Pear-shaped puffballs (Lycoperdon pyriforme) on deadwood
images.suggested_caption: Pear-shaped Puffball (Lycoperdon pyriforme)

images.description: Grows under trees, moveable ring, flesh reddens when cut or bruised. Can be digestive irritant to some
images.suggested_alt_text: Shaggy Parasol (Chlorophyllum rhacodes) mushroom with characteristic shaggy cap
images.suggested_caption: Shaggy Parasol (Chlorophyllum rhacodes) - edible but can cause digestive upset in some people

images.description: Tiny white fungus with very primitive decurrent gills, found in damp areas near Willow and Alder
images.suggested_alt_text: Delicatula integrella - tiny white fungus with primitive gills
images.suggested_caption: Delicatula integrella - an uncommon species found in damp woodland

images.description: Very obvious yellow staining when scratching stem base, gills greyish-brown, carbolic smell especially when cooking
images.suggested_alt_text: Yellow Staining Mushroom (Agaricus xanthodermus) held in hand showing characteristic yellow staining on stem base
images.suggested_caption: Yellow Staining Mushroom (Agaricus xanthodermus) - POISONOUS - note the yellow staining at the stem base

images.description: Unidentified fungus species - image too indistinct to differentiate
images.suggested_alt_text: Unidentified fungus specimen from Farthing Downs fungi foray
images.suggested_caption: Fungus specimen found during the 2014 fungi walk

images.description: Pale pink-lilac crowded jelly buttons on fallen beech
images.suggested_alt_text: Neobulgaria pura - pale pink-lilac jelly-like fungus on fallen beech wood
images.suggested_caption: Neobulgaria pura growing on fallen beech at Farthing Downs

images.description: Small yellow to orange blobs on barkless fallen timber
images.suggested_alt_text: Jelly Spot (Dacrymyces stillatus) - small yellow-orange jelly blobs on dead wood
images.suggested_caption: Jelly Spot (Dacrymyces stillatus) - common on fallen timber

images.description: Soft creamy-brown shell-like fungus on dead wood, elastic cap skin peels off. Found on fallen Beech trunk
images.suggested_alt_text: Peeling Oysterling (Crepidotus mollis) - shell-like fungus on beech trunk
images.suggested_caption: Peeling Oysterling (Crepidotus mollis) - probably this species, found on fallen beech

images.description: Unidentified fungus species - image too indistinct to differentiate
images.suggested_alt_text: Unidentified fungus specimen from Farthing Downs fungi foray
images.suggested_caption: Fungus specimen found during the 2014 fungi walk

images.description: Small tan caps with glistening particles, growing in tufts on wood
images.suggested_alt_text: Glistening Inkcap (Coprinellus micaceus) - small tan mushrooms with sparkling particles
images.suggested_caption: Glistening Inkcap (Coprinellus micaceus) - note the glittering particles on the cap

images.description: Thin bracket fungus with creamy pores, grows in tiers on dead wood. This specimen is old, lacking attractive bright colour bands
images.suggested_alt_text: Turkey Tail bracket fungus (Trametes versicolor) growing in tiers on dead wood
images.suggested_caption: Turkey Tail (Trametes versicolor) - older specimen on dead wood

images.description: Pinky-rose-brown colour, very variable appearance with 3 different gill lengths
images.suggested_alt_text: The Deceiver (Laccaria laccata) - variable pinkish-brown mushroom
images.suggested_caption: The Deceiver (Laccaria laccata) - probably this species, named for its variable appearance

images.description: Small tan caps with glistening particles, growing in tufts on wood
images.suggested_alt_text: Glistening Inkcap (Coprinellus micaceus) cluster
images.suggested_caption: Glistening Inkcap (Coprinellus micaceus)

images.description: Bracket fungus - lower surface view showing pore surface
images.suggested_alt_text: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - underside showing white pore surface
images.suggested_caption: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - lower surface, named because drawings can be made on the white pore surface

images.description: Bracket fungus - upper surface of old specimen
images.suggested_alt_text: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - old bracket showing brown upper surface
images.suggested_caption: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - aged specimen, upper surface

images.description: Small white puffball growing in leaf litter, small 'pearls' that rub off. Lovely fresh specimens
images.suggested_alt_text: Common Puffballs (Lycoperdon perlatum) - fresh white specimens with pearly surface texture in autumn leaves
images.suggested_caption: Common Puffball (Lycoperdon perlatum) - edible when young and white inside

images.description: Medium sized pink to lilac cap, growing in beech litter, smell of radish
images.suggested_alt_text: Lilac Bonnet (Mycena pura) - pink-lilac mushroom in leaf litter
images.suggested_caption: Lilac Bonnet (Mycena pura) - POISONOUS - attractive but not to be eaten

images.description: Grows on stumps in profusion, sulphur-coloured gills darken as purplish spores mature
images.suggested_alt_text: Sulphur Tuft (Hypholoma fasciculare) - yellow mushroom cluster on tree stump
images.suggested_caption: Sulphur Tuft (Hypholoma fasciculare) - POISONOUS - very common on dead wood

images.description: Golden-brown viscous caps with margins drying paler, grows in tufts on stumps. Can be confused with very poisonous Galerina marginata. Here in poor condition
images.suggested_alt_text: Sheathed Woodtuft (Kuehneromyces mutabilis) cluster on wood - in poor condition
images.suggested_caption: Sheathed Woodtuft (Kuehneromyces mutabilis) - caution: can be confused with deadly Galerina marginata

images.description: Bracket fungus - upper surface view
images.suggested_alt_text: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - upper surface of bracket
images.suggested_caption: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - upper surface

images.description: Pale pink-lilac crowded jelly buttons on fallen beech
images.suggested_alt_text: Neobulgaria pura - jelly-like fungus clusters on beech wood
images.suggested_caption: Neobulgaria pura - close-up of this distinctive jelly fungus

images.description: Close-up of tiny greyish caps on rotting wood
images.suggested_alt_text: Fairy bonnets (Coprinellus disseminatus) - close-up showing delicate greyish caps
images.suggested_caption: Fairy bonnets (Coprinellus disseminatus) - close-up view

images.description: Encrusting resupinate fungus forming creamy waxy patches over bare soil and plant remains. Found in moss on decayed fallen broadleaf tree
images.suggested_alt_text: Sebacina incrustans - waxy encrusting fungus on decayed wood and moss
images.suggested_caption: Sebacina incrustans - an uncommon encrusting fungus found on fallen wood

images.description: Lower surface showing pores with exit holes of gall fly larvae - rarely seen feature with nipple-shaped galls
images.suggested_alt_text: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) showing gall fly larvae exit holes in pore surface
images.suggested_caption: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - rare view showing fungus gall fly damage on pore surface

notes: This collection documents the 2014 Fungi Foray led by Ray Tantram. 45 species were found during the walk, with 29 photographed. Species identifications are based on the original HTML documentation. Three images contain unidentified species that may require expert review. Several poisonous species are included - these should be clearly labelled on the website.
